page.title: 19Anglican Churches in Ryhope
page.content: The main{Christian religions}have churches in the Ryhope area. Those who worship in other denominations have to travel into Sunderland to practise their faith. The original church, ministering to the needs of the Church of England community, was built in 1826. Later it was converted into a school. It is now used as a rent office as there is a purpose-built school opposite the present church. This is the Parish church of{St. Paul's}which was built in 1870.The vicar is the Rev.Fletcher. St.Paul's is the mother church of {St.Aidan's,}Grangetown which began as a mission church in 1883 until the present church was built in 1911. {The Church of St.Francis of Assisi ministers to the spiritual needs of the patients in{Cherry Knowle {Hospital. }
